title: How to Make Chocolate Frosted Flakes Cookies

steps.headline: Cover a baking tray with parchment paper.
Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy using an electric mixer.
Pour in the oil and blend again.
Crack in the egg and add the vanilla.
Fold in the salt and baking soda.
steps.description: Blend on low speed until well-mixed.

steps.headline: Add the oats and flour.
steps.description: Mix on low speed until the cookie dough starts to get thick.

steps.headline: Fold in the Frosted Flakes and chocolate chips.
Using a mini ice cream scoop, scoop the cookie dough onto the baking tray.
Have the cookie dough chill for about an hour.
Have the cookies bake for about 9-11 minutes, until the chocolate chips melt and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cookies to cool for about five minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the cookies on a serving plate and serve with a glass of milk. Enjoy!

text: Cover a baking tray with parchment paper.  Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy using an electric mixer.  Pour in the oil and blend again.  Crack in the egg and add the vanilla. Mix until well-combined. Fold in the salt and baking soda. Blend on low speed until well-mixed. Add the oats and flour. Mix on low speed until the cookie dough starts to get thick. Fold in the Frosted Flakes and chocolate chips. Blend until well-combined. Using a mini ice cream scoop, scoop the cookie dough onto the baking tray.  Have the cookie dough chill for about an hour.  Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Have the cookies bake for about 9-11 minutes, until the chocolate chips melt and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cookies to cool for about five minutes.  Serve. Place the cookies on a serving plate and serve with a glass of milk. Enjoy!
